messageBody:
On 1/5/07, Vietchau Nguyen <vietchau.nguyen@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Mike,
>
> I guess I didn't write as clear as I should... QA wants to run some
> tests, I guess, more functional than unit test...

Cool, always good to have those ;-)

> and a senior colleague
> has suggested to me to use JUnit. I have never written any test for QA
> before and I don't know what tool is better out there

I realize this is a "JUnit" mailing, but nonetheless...

Consider the possibility that Fit or FitNesse might be a useful tool
for more "customer-based" [functional, end-to-end] "tests"

More info for Fit:
http://fit.c2.com/

More info on FitNesse:
http://fitnesse.org/

The simplest way to describe the relationship between the two:
- Fit is the "engine" [certainly usable on its own]
- FitNesse is an out-of-the-box WebServer/Wiki wrapping Fit

If you have more questions for me on these items, please email me
personally (as, again, this is a JUnit list)

> and so I just take
> advice from the person who has used JUnit before and highly recommend
> it. As for testing subset of the tests, it's just an option, when they
> want to check something specifically and not have to test the whole suit
> (for example, some tests fail and they need to re-test only those with
> different parameters on another run).

I see, cool.

Cheers...
--MB
